Articles.Content:
I built a missile frigate for Spirit Wolf. Here's pics:

Armament:

4 Smart missiles

2 Forward docking ports for additional weapons. (Anyone have suggestions on what I should put there?)

Crew:

2 in the top can 2 in the central can.

Features:

3 top docking and resupply ports for fighters.

Side docking ports for refueling.

Parts:

314 (Without smart missiles)

The ship is quite sturdy, launches nicely and can make it to Jool. I'm still working on getting it to Laythe. Just did my first test flight to Jool but forgot to fill up on fuel before I left. It got into Jool orbit but ran out of fuel there.

I am pleased to announce that Sierra Space Industries has come on scene as a logistical workhorse. We offer our services in many areas of logistics including ammunition and supply transport, refueling, mobilization, heavy lift, repair, and escort.

Our first product we are offering is the Razorcat heavy escort fighter.

We are offering this craft under exclusive contract to Spiritwolf. The ship is currently still in prototyping at this moment. The armament is 12 Ares weaponry torpedoes, which are faster and harder hitting than any other fighter size torpedo on the market, and heavy guided torpedoes.

ok we declare we are joining on the side of Spiritwolf, for the greater glory of both nations. We can give as many Inflexibles as you may need.

You have failed me my young Padawan...

Here's mine. still working on it as it dose not want to get into space. But anyway it is supposed to be a tanker/ mobility extender ie help Macy dean get his battle cursers to the battle sight with out running out of gas

Just before the battle for Laythe, a small group of pilots realized that Spirit Wolf was doomed to fail against Hanland. They found each other one day in the hangar of the Spirit of Kerbin. They formulated plan in hushed whispers and then quietly went their separate ways. The next day a small, jury rigged scooter left the Spirit of Kerbin. Up in the bridge, a small blip showed up on the radar, but it was waved aside for an incoming transmission from HanlandÃ¢â‚¬Â¦

On the surface, the escaped team had located the downed, stolen Isprit. They quickly began building a small rover. One man went over to the next hill and saw a small fire with a kerbal next to it. As he walked closer he saw he wore an Isprit mask. He must be the crashed pilot! The next day, they had built a small rocket, with the ability to reach orbit. They became the Ã¢â‚¬Å“Swamp Foxes.Ã¢â‚¬Â The scooter to come is their hit and run ship to help Spirit Wolf, HOWEVER, they are a different organization, and therefore not against raiding Spirit Wolf for supplies... Just sayin.

Is this story stupid?

SSI's new Razorcat fighter is officially ready to see action. Only one test remains before the Razorcat is sent off to make spiritwolf jealous of SSI tech (a range test, to see if it can make it to Lathe and back).

Range testing will be a piece of cake. The ship manages to keep 80% of the center tanks from the launch stages. That plus the skipper engine makes it have more than enough dV to get to Lathe so long as it keeps the pusher stage. The real test is can it get there without it. It has 5 large 1.25m tanks and 3 LV-909 engines.

Chozo, seeing most of our posts here are mainly discussions about how specific arrangements of parts make the biggest boom, how about we spare Macey the pain of having to browse through our submissions and instead have links on the first page linked to our submissions back here? It would surely save him a ton of time, and we get to see how many ACTUAL submissions we have.

A concept of what I'm saying:

AID SHIPS

[Company name/Builder's name] Ship name

(link to post)

-Short description

How about it? Macey's probably bogged down with emails right now, and a forage through 60-odd pages ain't going to do him no good.

What submissions would be deemed viable,then?

Pretty much, at least for spiritwolf and aid ship submissions. There are a lot of cool ships in this thread, so going through them all is going to be entertaining.

Pretty much, at least for spiritwolf and aid ship submissions. There are a lot of cool ships in this thread, so going through them all is going to be entertaining.

I'd best get my own documentation settled then

Ship- Sentinel MK17R5 "Seeder" (Mass Area Coverage Research and Retrieval Shuttle)

"It's not how you get there that counts, it's how much you can throw out the window."

--Halwell Kerman, Sentinel Handler (KIA, NERVA reactor cowling failure)

Company- Argent Institute

Company Bio - What makes a good company great? Well, as our Research Department would've put it, more science. Less death, more science. We represent the scientific side of the once-united Argent Institute, may Jeb bless it's shattered corpse. Two missiles was all it took to send this company hurtling to it's doom, splitting the divisions, each to fend for his own. Two missiles, launched by Jeb knows who, targeting both our orbital facilities, sending them tumbling out of the skies.

But that time has past. News of conflict has once again reached our ears. We know not what the Military Department plans for this engagement, but we know what we have to do.

You have what's left of our ships at your disposal, Spiritwolf. Make them count.

Allegiance- Spiritwolf

Part count- 255 (Minus launch stage)

Craft file- http://www./download/62h2xy8h7s73qea/%5BAI%5D_Sentinel_MK17R5_-_Seeder.craft

Proof of Travel:

Eve (Crashed during Aerobrake)

Duna

Jool (Coming soon)

Operation Manual

1 - Toggles solar panels

3 - Deploys satellites (2x)

4 - Deploys satellites (2x)

5 - Deploys satellites (2x)

6 - Deploys satellites (2x)

8 - Toggles primary ion drives

9 - Toggles secondary ion drives

0 - Deploys emergency parachute (best used with eject)

EJECT - Ejects crew capsule

GEAR - Starts up navigational and scientific equipment

Edited July 28, 2013 by Mygnol
Added documentation.

Produced a series of ground vehicles.

Respectively from left to right,

I1 Light Personnel carrier.

N/A

U1 Taskmaster, Engineering Vehicle

Developed by BF inc. (Black Factory Incorporated) To service mining and engineering crews.

Can seat 7 kerbals, One pilot and six passengers. Using 7 thermoelectric generators, aswell as a backup solar array, Enabling it to move almost perpetually.

Aditionally it provides a full suite of scientific equipment.

6 liquid fuel engines and a small fuel store, enable it to hover short distances in low gravity.

All this Earning it a reputation as a trusty workhorse.

The Taskmaster can operate perfectly without a pilot, utilizing an onboard computer.

UM1 Bloatbull, Heavy tanker vehicle

Developed by BF inc. (Black Factory Incorporated) to service mining and engineering crews.

The Bloatbull's Primary function is as a heavy groundbased tanker, It carries 360 units of liquid fuel for transfer through its rear docking port.

In addition it can seat 4 kerbals, not counting its pilot. To allow for limited personnel transportation.

The Bloatbull can operate perfectly without a pilot, utilizing an onboard computer.

U3 Warthog, Missile defence platform

Developed by BF inc. (Black Factory Incorporated) To Provide fighting ability to mining and engineering crews.

Armed with four missiles, meant to provide protection and ability of agressive initiative to mining colonies. Can seat one pilot, though it is well advised to keep ones distance when the warthog is firing.

The Warthog can operate perfectly without a pilot, utilizing an onboard computer.

T1 Skitterhog, Personnel transport.

Developed by BF inc. (Black Factory Incorporated) To service mining and engineering crews.

The Skitterhog is a 9 kerbal personnel transport, Seating 1 pilot and 8 passengers.

Utilizing three thermoelectric generators and two large batteries, It can move unrestricted in almost all conditions.

The Skitterhog can operate perfectly without a pilot, utilizing an onboard computer.

UM2 Hogpit, Mobile on-mission housing unit

Developed by BF inc. (Black Factory Incorporated) to service mining and engineering crews.

The hogpit provides relatively comfortable on-mission housing for 8 kerbals, Equipped with heat and moisture regulating systems, A complete communications suite, and extra storage for rations, tools and personal effects.

The Hogpit can operate perfectly without a pilot, utilizing an onboard computer.

Edited July 28, 2013 by St33m

Vessel Name: HMS CHARON

Vessel Class: AID SHIP - DEDICATED PERSONNEL TRANSPORT VEHICLE

Vessel Owner: NORTHERN KINGDOM MERCHANT NAVY (ON LEASE)

Allegiance: SPIRITWOLF CORPORATION

Tonnage: 180 TONS (LOADED); 45 TONS (DRY)

Part Count: 124

Description:

The HMS Charon is a midweight long-range personnel transport ship built and operated by the Northern Kingdom Navy. The Northern Kingdom is a constitutional monarchy located on the small peninsula across the sea from KSC. For several centuries the Kingdom held the largest empire in the history of Kerbin, thanks to its naval superiority, technological prowess, and rather excessive and outright silly use of zeppelins and clockwork-and-steam powered mechasoldiers. However, with the discovery of non-scalding electricity and the beginning of the space age, the Northern Kingdom soon lost much of its former power. While still holding much political sway on Kerbin proper, it is slowly leasing out or selling most of its space-based assets.

This particular vessel, the HMS Charon, was designed by Northern Kingdom engineers and constructed and launched at Kerbal Space Center under contract some ten years ago. For the past decade it has transported hundreds of Kingdom citizens, colonists, and soldiers to as far as Duna, but has spent most of its career servicing the well-traveled and relatively safe Kerbin-Mun route. Unfortunately, recent events in the Joolian system have made space-based trade dangerous, especially with unarmored vessels like the Charon. As such, the Kingdom has mothballed or leased off much of its remaining fleet to Spiritwolf corporation until the conflict can be resolved.

The Charon is designed with versatility in mind. While only requiring a single crewmember to operate, up to twenty fully-equipped Kerbals can be transported in the ship's comfortable holds. Three standard 1m Docking ports allow multiple and simultaneous attachment options for landing craft, transfer vehicles, fueling tanks, or temproary modules. In addition, the ship boasts a unique Modular Engine System. This 2m docking port attached to the rear of the vessel allows the ship to be fit with any variety of propulsion options, from clusters of small but efficient nuclear engines to a roaring Mainsail. The vessel is currently equipped with three LV-T45 Liquid Fuel Engines, providing a compromise between efficiency and speed. This configuration is sufficient for round-trip excursions to lunar systems or one-way trips to planetary systems. THe ship is also quite nimble for its size, being equipped with three SAS reaction wheels and a full RCS system.

The HMS Charon is currently on a five-year lease to Spiritwolf Corporation, and is parked in a 75km orbit above the moon Laythe until further notice.

Proof of Travel:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Craft and Persistence Files:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/11050535/HMS%20Charon.rar

WARNING: The HMS Charon is NOT approved or designed for direct combat scenarios. The outer hull tanks are not approved for collisions exceeding 5m/s. If operating in a high combat risk area, a military escort is highly encouraged. Please note that direct military engagement voids this vehicle's warranty.
